boardgame.name: American Rails
American Rails: The Barons of 1850
Railroad Barons
boardgame.description: In American Rails, each player assumes the role of a wealthy capitalist managing a portfolio of stocks and bonds in six fictional railroad companies. Through ruthless negotiation and rigorous planning, players struggle to increase the value of their holdings and reap the profits. The player with the most money at the end of the game will become the nation's first railroad baron and win the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;This luckless game was inspired by John Bohrer's development of Chicago Express and the Historic Railroads System from Winsome Games. Set in the United States east of the Mississippi, American Rails features player-controlled variable turn order, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;city dilution_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, and variable set-ups, giving this cutthroat train game an unprecedented level of replayability._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: ET41: Vuelven los trenes. Dos rios que hacen un juego y la Galaxxxia
The Good, The Board and The Dinner With Caroline: Episode 56 “Randomness”

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable
